page.title: 04BRENDON HILL FARM
page.content: The residents have lived in this area since 1948. The local farms vary in size from 200-900 acres (80-360 hectares), Brendon Hill Farm being the biggest in the area.Wimbleball reservoir has been built since they came here. Generally, the weather is quite good in summer and the winters mild although there may be heavy snowfalls. The worst winter they can remember was in 1963 when they could not get out from Christmas until April. Both participate in local life;the farmer's wife plays the organ in the local church (Brompton Regis Methodist Church). The farmer and his wife organise a gymkhana on the farm every year. This is not just a horsing event but a social gathering with a disco etc.
